intro: Euphrasia aspera, commonly known as the rough eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, and it has a fibrous root system. Euphrasia aspera is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
